entry.title: 5/19 - Call to Printmakers: Stories in Print
entry.content:
Rockaway Artists Alliance
üìç Rockaway Park, NY, United States
üé® Printmaking
üìÖ 05/19/2019 deadline
üí∞ $50.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

From the printed word to narrative scenes using images and symbols and beyond to the mysterious realm of abstraction. Printmaking has a story to tell..

We want to inspire artists to reflect on their stories either personal or popular from daily life, imagination or those drawn from a text, well-known folk tale or myths and come up with imagery that iconizes these stories.

Prints mixed with Writings ‚Ä¢ Illustrations ‚Ä¢ Narrative Etchings & Abstractions ‚Ä¢
Artist Books ‚Ä¢ Photography ‚Ä¢ Mixed Media

Printmaking methods include various forms of intaglio, aquatint, monoprint, lithography, silkscreen, stencils, photography, book arts, pen and ink, sculptural and experimental processes.

Stories in Print is a curated show by members of RAA Press


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Submit online at rockawayartistsalliance.org/stories-in-print

For more information call 718-474-0861 or email exhibitions@raanyc.org.

entry.title: 5/31 - CALL FOR EXHIBITS 2018/19 ‚Äì GIFTS OF ART - MICHIGAN MEDICINE, UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
entry.content:
GIFTS OF ART - MICHIGAN MEDICINE, UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
üìç Ann Arbor , MI, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 05/31/2019 deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

CALL FOR EXHIBITS 2018/19 ‚Äì GIFTS OF ART - MICHIGAN MEDICINE, UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
The Gifts of Art Program is seeking submissions for solo and group art exhibits for the September 2019 to August 2020 exhibition year. One of the first and most comprehensive arts in healthcare programs in the nation, Gifts of Art brings the world of art and music to Michigan Medicine at the University of Michigan. Nine 2-D and 3-D galleries throughout the medical center are viewed by approximately 10,000 people a day and display over 30 exhibits a year. The Exhibition Program is designed to calm nerves, lift spirits, and engage minds. This supports the healing process and reduces the stress and anxiety often associated with a healthcare setting. Engaging with the arts in a medical setting can be an especially powerful, even transformative experience for patients and visitors. For more information about Gifts of Art at Michigan Medicine, please visit www.med.umich.edu/goa .

To see the full prospectus and submit to this call, please visit:
www.michiganmedicinegiftsofart.submittable.com/submit

SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS
‚Ä¢ Original artwork only
‚Ä¢ Enough artwork to fill an entire gallery site
‚Ä¢ Resume/CV
‚Ä¢ A description of the proposed exhibit
‚Ä¢ A minimum of 15 quality JPEG images for solo artists
‚Ä¢ A minimum of 24 quality JPEG images for group shows
‚Ä¢ No application fee
IMPORTANT DATES
‚Ä¢ DEADLINE FOR SUBMISSIONS - May 31, 2019
‚Ä¢ NOTIFICATIONS SENT TO ARTISTS - July 15, 2019
QUESTIONS? Call Gifts of Art at 734.936.8829 or email kmtalley@umich.edu


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

https://michiganmedicinegiftsofart.submittable.com
